description: An empty green plastic triangular prism; the casing of a Dardick .38 Tround. With a little effort, you could reload it.

Basic .38 Tround ammunition. A modernized take on an experiment from the 1960s. Its triangular hull means you can fit more of it into the same space you could fit rounded ammunition, making it theoretically ideal for machine guns.

.38 Tround ammunition, with a three-projectile Triplex load dealing increased damage at a shorter range. A modernized take on an experiment from the 1960s. Its triangular hull means you can fit more of it into the same space you could fit rounded ammunition, making it theoretically ideal for machine guns.
